timeline.bodyText:
This could be a little surprising for people to first learn about the new repo from here.
We should probably also have a blurb about the new repo on the front-page readme.
Can we just say, if this is an issue for version 2.0.0 or higher, please file it here?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Please start filing all issues in our new repo: [https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose.](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose)
          
          
            
            If this is an issue for version `2.0.0` or higher, please file it in our new repo: [GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose).

replies.bodyText:
Well remember:
a.) not many external folks are filing issues these days (so relatively low impact),
b.) we're only a few weeks away from releasing 2.0,
c.) the Spring Cloud announcement that this is happening is almost 18 months old,
d.) all devs should be cherry-picking fixes to both repos anyway (doesn't matter if the bug is 2.0 or not), and
e.) Issues in the new repo fall under our new SLO.
replies.author: ttomsu

replies.bodyText:
Some good points, but in that case, "Please start filing..." sounds a bit weak.
Wouldn't we want to say then, "Please file all issues in the new repo."?
replies.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure we need to say that. Some people might want minor enhancements, and it might be OK.

            We are not accepting new feature requests for Spring Cloud GCP 1.x.

replies.bodyText: I'd still opt for language strongly encouraging activity in the new repo over the old. Not only because this repo is going into maintenance, but also because we can't control when it will be released. Feature request X in the new repo can be asked on Monday and in the user's hands by Friday.
